I've been playing Dead by Daylight on and off every patch since beta, and as a veteran player, I feel my opinions on the current state of the game have some kind of credit.

Dead by Daylight is absolutely one of the most fun games I've ever played on PC.  Playing by myself and with friends, the game is just genuinely fun.  I have primarily spent most of my time in the game as a survivor, but I have a decent amount of experience as killer.  Each killer even with the same base mechanics, is fun and interesting to play against each game.  No two killers in DBD are ever the same, each killer, (both player and character), facilitate how the match will unfold.  You can strategize from the beginning of the game how you want to play it.  This can be done by outlining a strategy, selecting certain perks, etc.  

One of the major complaints people have with DBD is the repetitiveness of it.  Yes, DBD can get repetitive at points, but I would give the same advice to anyone who has this complaint about any game; just take a break.  I have walked away from Dead by Daylight for one to two weeks at a time, and every time a new patch is released, or I even just get the itch to play it, I come back.    

DBD has a weird learning curve.  This curve not being as much game mechanics and things like that, more so just game knowledge.  For example, when a teammate is hooked, deciding whether it is a good idea to save them over taking a generator or something along that line.  On top of this, the progression is a bit weird.  After playing a game, your score is calculated through "Bloodpoints".  You can go to the Bloodweb and spend your points on items, attachments, perks, etc.  While I have never really been a huge fan of RNG-based progression, Dead by Daylight does it well.  Each new page of the Bloodweb is procedurally generated, allowing you access to new items every time.  This progression honestly just works.  The Bloodweb grind on new characters and such is really the only point of the game where it can start to feel like just that, a grind.  

One common occurrence is people disliking new killers on-release for being overpowered.  One thing I love about DBD is the ability for either side, killer or survivor, to outplay the other.  From faking wall movements to 180 or 360 juking, DBD allows for either side to use opportunities presented around the map to their advantage.  Playing against a newly-released killer is always difficult because reading patch notes don't give you the experience necessary to play against them effectively.  Therefore, I would recommend, if you can, always just trying a new killer on release to help yourself understand their ability, perks, etc.

Finally, a lot of people in the community complain a lot about bugs and such.  Being a beta player, bugs and such were a common occurrence, and their occasional appearances now don't bother me.  The game has some weird animations and things which can pull you out of the experience a bit, but it never makes you feel like you're not playing a well-made game.  I'm not somebody who keeps up with the Dev Diaries or anything, but from just reading patch notes and other release articles, it's very apparent that the devs listen to the community and try to make it as enjoyable as possible for the players.  

Dead by Daylight is a game that caused a big ruckus on the scene for being a very creative and well-thought-out concept.  On release, some people didn't like it, and some people did.  For $15, Dead by Daylight is very good gaming experience even for people who don't like horror.  I would even argue that it's worth picking up as an essential for people just getting into PC gaming alongside CSGO, TF2, etc.  Dead by Daylight has its issues just like any game, but I feel I've had enough fun and experience to absolutely recommend it for anyone interested.  We can hopefully only get better from here.

前のレビュー内容が1世紀前だったので更新。

非対称鬼ごっこゲーム。サバイバーとキラーの二つの陣営があり、サバイバーはキラーに隠れつつ発電機を5台修理する。キラーはサバイバー全員をエンティティの生贄…全員ころすのが目的です。
サバイバーはキラーに見つかっていない時は常に発電機を修理すれば脱出への道が短くなります。キラーはその発電機爆速修理をされる前に早めに一人葬っておかないと容易に脱出されてしまいます。

もう一つ有利にさせる内容が発電機残り1台の時、一点に固まらせないこと。固まると殺人鬼の発電機巡回速度が上がり、例え4人でも状況が厳しくなるかもしれません。

立ち回りについて説明してから現環境について言いますと…
上記の通り、キラーは一人減らしてからが本番。4人いればキラーは不利。サバイバーが自由な時間が多いと、発電機はすぐ直ります。
一番の問題は格差マッチで現環境のゲームバランスの通りにならないことです。赤帯でもちょっとよくわからないっす！

Bu oyunda bilgisayarınızda 30 fps alamıyorsanız iade etmenizi öneririm. Oyuna başta ne kadar çok sövdüysem şu an oyunu aldığım için pişman değilim. Oyun kesinlikle fiyatını hak ediyor. Ne kadar başlarda jeneratör yapamasamda oyun sizlere soğuk kanlı olmayı öğretiyor. Belki 13. Cuma'yı da oynayabilirsiniz. Ama onu oynamadığım için bu oyunu tercih ederim. Kesinlikle Outlast gibi korkulacak oyunlara bin basar çünkü beni oyun en az 100 defa yerimden hoplattırdı. Arkadaşlarınızla Hayatta Kalan eleman olursanız işte o zaman eğleneceksiniz bu oyunu arkadaşlarınızla birlikte oynamanızı öneririm.

One of the best survival games out there, Dead by Daylight lets you play as a killer to hunt down and kill all four players in the map or as a survivor to work with other survivors to escape from the killer alive. The game is like hide and seek, its repetitive at times, but is also really a fun adrenaline rushing experience that will make you want to play again. The only negative issue about the game in my opinion is the match finding system. Most of the time it cancels finding a match that you'll have to start looking for it again, so it may take awhile getting into a game. But once your in the game, the fun begins. 

[h1] Dead by Daylight is an intense horror game that will keep your heart racing trying to survive or kill them all. [/h1]
[b] 8/10 [/b]

This game is amazing, but I don't agree with a lot of the changes that have happened to the game. 



1st:
Matchmaking and being noob friendly. After 900 hours, I'm used to everything this game has to offer. But any of my friends I try to bring to the game don't end up enjoying because of how un-noob friendly it is. I don't blame this on BHVR, but since there isn't a constant 50k+ people you can't pick and choose what matches you want. So a new survivor or a new killer ends up with experienced people in their lobby.

3rd:
BHVR doesn't test anything like they used to with the community. By that, I mean utilizing the PTB. I understand not using it for content releases, but Freddy's release wouldn't have been as bad if we had just gotten to test it seperate from ranked.
-----

Positives:

1st:
Addictive gameplay. This game is extremely addicting. In just a little over a year, I've clocked in almost 1 thousand hours. Once you get passed the beginning grind, you keep wanting to come back for the adrenaline for playing as survivor or thrill of the hunt for playing as killer

2nd:
Plenty of content. This game has a FUCK ton of content. I mean it has a lot. All of the DLC is either relatively cheap or free. There are a lot of cosmetic packs and straight up killers/survivor DLCs.

3rd:
Transparent developers. BHVR doesn't try to hide from us, with weekly developer streams (even when they were moving offices, they still did a stream) to update us on whatever is going on with the game. This gives us some sort of portal for communication directly with the developers.

Conclusion:
Thank you for reading my review, this game is amazing but it still has a long ways to go.

Played over 50 hours now since Sept 2016, The game at first was annoying since no one knew what to do. So i stopped playing for a few months up untill Feb this year (2017). Honestly im amazed from where the game has come. I love the game now and the new killers. The survivors are getting smarter with how they save you and do Gens. This makes the overall experience much more enjoyable. It can get stressful if you're playing solo and people rather save themselves then you but its understandable, the graphics are great and the overall concept of the game is fantastic. Still wish there was a [b] Communication in game VIA voice or typing [/b] .
